alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 6:53AM EST until January 05 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL IN SPOTS TODAY... .Low pressure will gradually move south of the Gulf of Maine today. Cold air will filter in from the north changing rain over to a light, perhaps intermittent, mix of freezing drizzle, sleet, and snow. It will not add up to much but will make for slippery travel at times. The western Maine mountains will pick up 3 to 6 inches of snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow and sleet accumulations of 2 to 4 inches for a storm total of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Slippery roads are expected today due to a mix of snow, sleet, and freezing drizzle.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
